elements.title: Louise McKinney (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Louise McKinney (pictured) was the first woman in the British Empire to be sworn in as an elected legislator?

elements.title: IOUs of Cincinnati (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a television station spent so little on programming that a media columnist called it the "IOUs of Cincinnati"?

elements.title: Sheila Egoff (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sheila Egoff, Canada's first professor of children's literature, returned to her library work immediately after retirement?

elements.title: Indie sleaze (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Indie sleaze era, from approximately 2006 to 2012, was described by singer Gwenno as "very debauched, and probably the last moment where kids had been able to do whatever they want"?

elements.title: Yuhanon Mar Meletius (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Malankara Orthodox Syrian Church bishop Yuhanon Mar Meletius said that Christian Sangh Parivar sympathizers are "moving on a suicidal path"?

elements.title: 1993 Bataan gubernatorial recall election (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ding Roman defeated his cousin Tet Garcia in the 1993 Bataan gubernatorial recall election?

elements.title: Augustus Smith (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after depopulating the island of Samson, Augustus Smith established a deer park there, only for the deer to escape to the neighbouring island of Tresco?

elements.title: Cauley Square (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the man who built Cauley Square originally used the village to ship his tomatoes?
